data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2995572,"name":"Anthony Brogni","username":"Isopod00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isopod00/{size}/207633_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T22:54:21.393Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello, my team is using a Mecanum drivetrain powered by NEOs and Spark Maxes this year, and we would very much like to get trajectory-following working. I think I understand it pretty well, but not 100% yet. I know that I need to get my ks, kv, and ka constants from characterizing the drivetrain and that I need to use the new SysID 2022 tool to do that, but how does it work with a mecanum drivetrain? Do I use the tool exactly as I would with a West Coast Drivetrain?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T23:35:23.715Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":63,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":363.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400912,"topic_slug":"how-to-characterize-a-mecanum-drivetrain","display_username":"Anthony Brogni","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44901,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"President of UMN Robotics - Ri3D | NASA Lunabotics"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-characterize-a-mecanum-drivetrain/400912/1","custom_user_title":"President of UMN Robotics - Ri3D | NASA Lunabotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2995630,"name":"Alex","username":"OrganicGroundGinger","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-21T00:34:57.224Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI don’t have an answer to your question, but I’d advise against using NEOs for your Mecanum. If you have it in your budget Falcons are much more durable, have more power, and have a much faster response Do you have a link to sources to help us learn how to begin to translate the LQR constants to x, y, and theta proportions?\u003cbr\u003e\nI assume the WPILib State Space docs…\u003c/p\u003e\u003caside class=\"onebox allowlistedgeneric\" data-onebox-src=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-intro.html#introduction-to-state-space-control\"\u003e\n  \u003cheader class=\"source\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg src=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/_static/FIRSTicon_RGB_withTM.ico\" class=\"site-icon\" width=\"64\" height=\"64\"\u003e\n\n      \u003ca href=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-intro.html#introduction-to-state-space-control\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eFIRST Robotics Competition Documentation\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/header\u003e\n\n  \u003carticle class=\"onebox-body\"\u003e\n    \u003cimg src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wpilibsuite/branding/main/png/wpilib-128.png\" class=\"thumbnail onebox-avatar\" width=\"128\" height=\"128\"\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-intro.html#introduction-to-state-space-control\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eIntroduction to State-Space Control\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n  \u003cp\u003eFrom PID to Model-Based Control: When tuning PID controllers, we focus on fiddling with controller
